title: Multiplication on the Soroban: Beyond Addition
description: Once your child masters addition, multiplication is the next step. Here's how the soroban handles times tables beautifully.

content.intro: Multiplication on the soroban is essentially repeated addition with smart place value handling. It requires knowing basic addition well first, but once that's solid, multiplication follows naturally.

sections.text: Before learning multiplication, your child should be comfortable with:
Soroban multiplication: Multiply digit by digit, placing products in the correct column, then add them all up.

items: Set 12 on the soroban (1 in tens, 2 in ones)

sections.text: For single digits, it's that simple. The real power shows with larger numbers.

items: Step 2: 3 × 4 = 12 (add to ones, carrying if needed)

sections.text: Soroban multiplication trains place value understanding deeply. Kids internalize why 23 × 4 = 92 through physical manipulation, not just memorization.

items: After 2-3 months of solid addition/subtraction practice
When carrying and borrowing are somewhat automatic
When the child knows basic times tables (even partially)
When they show interest or confidence

faq.question: Does my child need to know times tables first?
faq.answer: Basic times tables (1-5) help. Some kids learn times tables THROUGH soroban practice. Either order can work.

faq.question: Is soroban multiplication faster than regular?
faq.answer: Once mastered, yes. The place value handling becomes automatic, and mental visualization speeds up larger calculations significantly.

faq.question: How long does it take to learn multiplication on soroban?
faq.answer: After a foundation in addition, multiplication basics take 1-2 months. Multi-digit multiplication takes several more months of practice.
